intro: Aglaia halmaheirae, commonly known as the Halmahera aglaia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the Indonesian island of Halmahera, where it typically grows in lowland and montane forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem as a food source for various animals. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
